dashboard.label: Install the Splunk Universal Forwarder on your SQL Server

html.p: The Splunk Universal Forwarder may be installed as either the local system user or as a domain user. Follow the appropriate instructions in the Splunk Documentation for information on this topic.
Once the Splunk Universal Forwarder has been installed, you must allow the user that is running the Splunk Universal Forwarder access to the SQL Server.

ol.li: Start the SQL Server Management Studio
Connect to the SQL Server being configured
Log in as a user in the sysadmin role
In the left-hand navigation, open Security -> Logins
Right-click on Logins and select New Login...
In the Login Name box, enter the user that is running the Splunk Universal Forwarder
Click on OK to add the user
Double-click on the user you have just selected
Click on OK to update the server roles

html.p: If you installed the Splunk Universal Forwarder as the local system user, this is represented on the SQL Server as "NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM" and already exists. Ensure you perform the last 4 steps to enable the user as a sysadmin user.

You may also want to restrict the permissions granted to the Splunk process. This is outside the scope of these instructions. However, be aware that the splunk process needs system read access to all databases. It does not need to change any data. The sysadmin role already has these permissions.
We recommend linking the Splunk Universal Forwarder to a Splunk Deployment Server so that you may easily deploy the required add-ons from a central location.
